segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes near the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s standing in a puddle, but her face is so calm, like she’s in another world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the faucet is still running, and the water is just spilling over the edge.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink must be clogged, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s going to slip any second now, but she’s just polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading, and it’s going to make the floor even more dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll realize before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, but she’s too distracted to see them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene feels like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
